FuncDef: This command applies a packet arrival rate limit for the entire SAP/interface, above which packets will be market as discard eligible, in other words, out-profile/low-priority/yellow. The rate defined is a global rate limit for the interface regardless of the number of traffic flows. It is a per-SAP/interface rate.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies a packet arrival rate limit in packets per second. Values-1 to 65535, max (max indicates no limit).

Issues a tmnxCpmProtViolSapOutProf, tmnxCpmProtViolIfOutProf, or tmnxCpmProtViolSdpBindOutProf log event and tracks violating interfaces when the out-profile-rate is exceeded. Supported on CPM3 and above only.

ExtraInfo: Default: out-profile-rate 3000 for cpu-protection-policy-id 1-253out-profile-rate 6000 for cpu-protection-policy-id 254 (default access interface policy)out-profile-rate 3000 for cpu-protection-policy-id 255 (default network interface policy)
